Data: 2.00pm Andrew Flintoff wins the toss. England will bat.
Tait to Joyce, no run well, that was pretty erratic to start things off, but maybe because it's his first ball, he's been given the benefit of the doubt
Tait to Joyce, no run better, straighter, and good carry as well
Tait to Joyce, 1 wide oops! That's almost Harmisonesque. Pitched on the white lines and swung towards the slips
Tait to Joyce, no run wonderful response! Real pace, yorker length and inswinging. Joyce gets his bat down just in time
Tait to Joyce, FOUR runs strays onto the pads and that's clipped firmly through midwicket to bring up the first boundary of the day. Good shot
Tait to Joyce, no run banged in and bending back into the batsman. Joyce plays inside the line with a perpendicular bat
Tait to Joyce, 1 wide wild again. Arguably less wide than his first ball, but rightly called as Gilchrist takes in front of slip
Tait to Joyce, 2 runs leg-side again, and Joyce tickles the last ball down to fine leg. A woolly first over
Bracken to Loye, no run good start, full length, curving in, defended on the front foot
Bracken to Loye, 1 run gets it a fraction wrong this time. Loye flicks to leg to get off the mark
Bracken to Joyce, 1 wide bit of width, but not too much. Strange call, to be honest
Bracken to Joyce, no run tighter, and just back of a length. Joyce plays inside the line again
Bracken to Joyce, no run good probing length outside the left-hander's off stump
Bracken to Joyce, no run no stroke offered as the ball fizzes through
Bracken to Joyce, no run curving towards the slips, and edged towards the gully. Safe though
Tait to Loye, no run big booming outswing from Tait. Useful pace as well. Loye leaves alone
Tait to Loye, 2 runs starts on middle-and-leg, decent swing again, but easily clipped to midwicket
Tait to Loye, no run big appeal from Tait, but that looked to be sliding down leg. Loye was well squared up though. Hawkeye disagrees ...
Tait to Loye, no run fuller, outside off, and squirted to gully. Rapid
Tait to Loye, 1 wide 95mph, but misdirected, and slips past Loye's ribs for another extra
Tait to Loye, no run good pace again, Loye drawn into the drive, but controls his aggression
Tait to Loye, no run right up to the bat, and an inside-edge bobbles into the crease as Loye drives again. Better over
Bracken to Joyce, no run fizzes through, no stroke offered
Bracken to Joyce, no run probing, probing. No stroke again as the ball sits in the channel outside off stump
Bracken to Joyce, no run good discipline from Bracken.
Bracken to Joyce, no run outside off stump once again, Joyce shoulders arms once again
Bracken to Joyce, no run straighter, and this time Joyce is forced to defend. Drawn onto the front foot
Bracken to Joyce, no run excellent over. Joyce defends into the covers
Tait to Loye, no run banged in, takes the glove and dribbles into the covers. Good aggression
Tait to Loye, no run right up to the bat, hint of movement and watchfully defended back up the pitch
Tait to Loye, no run speared down the leg-side, takes the pad but Gilchrist runs round to field
Tait to Loye, 2 runs attempted yorker, 90mph-plus but no movement, and easily squeezed to square leg
Tait to Loye, 2 runs nicely timed through square leg, bit of a half-volley this time but Tait is finding a good rhythm after that erratic first over
Tait to Loye, no run booming full-toss, Loye flings the bat but the outswing deceives him and he under-edges into the slips.
Bracken to Joyce, no run a swish and a miss from Joyce - that was loose. Tempted by a hint of width, but good bounce and movement
Bracken to Joyce, 2 runs dropped! And that was a dolly. Joyce's first attacking move of the match, danced down the track, had a smear, and Tait at deep point fluffed a sitter
Bracken to Joyce, 1 wide outside off, tight call, but that won't improve Bracken's mood
Bracken to Joyce, no run tighter to the stumps and defended
Bracken to Joyce, 1 run fuller length, and pushed to leg
Bracken to Loye, SIX runs there he goes! It's that slog-sweep again, and it's a big, big six again! Slight top-edge, but what power! Twelve rows back, I reckon
Bracken to Loye, 1 run back on a good length, and solidly defended
Tait to Loye, no run fancy that, it's a wide one, and he chased it!
Tait to Loye, 1 run shorter, quicker, but defended on the hop into the vacant gully. 97mph that one, and Loye is shaking his finger, as well he might
Tait to Joyce, no run 96.1mph now, and that climbs past the left-hander's edge for Gilchrist to take above his head
Tait to Joyce, no run yorker! And a good one too. Hastily dug out by Joyce
Tait to Joyce, no run swinging again, but a bit short and easily defended into the leg-side
Tait to Joyce, no run right on the spot, swinging back towards off stump, and solidly pushed back up the pitch. Tidy stuff, and brutally quick as well!
Bracken to Loye, 1 run leg-side, and turned away for a quick single
Bracken to Joyce, FOUR runs width, and smacked! That's a lovely shot - down the track, on the up, and over the covers
Bracken to Joyce, no run shorter but straighter, and turned to leg with no great pace
Bracken to Joyce, 1 leg bye leg-sided again, clipped into space - in fact, it came off the pad but the intent was there
Bracken to Loye, FOUR runs there's the sweep again! But this time it's a wild outside-edge that flies high over the slips. Still, it'll do
Bracken to Loye, FOUR runs no edges this time! That's a fine sweep, fizzes through square leg to complete an expensive over!
Tait to Joyce, no run 94.9mph that time, but nicely timed even though the direction was lacking. Steered into the gully off the back foot
Tait to Joyce, 1 run good yorker, squeezed out to the gully
Tait to Loye, no run slightly short, but rapid and Loye can't time his clip through leg
Tait to Loye, no run quick! Short and climbing at Loye, who fends this off his nose with a bit of discomfort
Tait to Loye, no run that's that tempter again, and Loye is drawn into it once again. Beaten by the swing, and just as well for his sake

Tait to Loye, FOUR runs much better shot, up towards the blockhole but swinging away. He didn't try to smack it, but it went like the proverbial through the covers all the same. When it's coming at you at 97mph, you don't need to have a mow!
Clark to Joyce, no run right on the money first up. Defended, but there's no swing
Clark to Joyce, no run there's the intent. Joyce takes a couple of steps but defends nonetheless. Wasn't quite there for the shot
Clark to Joyce, FOUR runs short, and smeared through midwicket - that was a front-foot pull and it was hammered. Good batting
Clark to Joyce, 3 runs fuller, but well timed through midwicket again. Clipped rather than carved though
Clark to Loye, no run outside off, left alone
Clark to Loye, 1 wide wider, and Loye flinches in his eagerness to have a mow, but managed to restrain himself
Clark to Loye, 1 run decent over for England
McGrath to Loye, no run line and length, as you'd expect. Respectfully defended
McGrath to Loye, no run same again. No pace, no movement, but just there
McGrath to Loye, 1 wide flashy flashy! It's that width again, and Loye just can't quite get it right with that shot. But it's too wide
McGrath to Loye, no run straighter, and left alone
McGrath to Loye, no run excellent line and length this time, and some big seam movement back towards the stumps. Loye leaves alone with a flourish
McGrath to Loye, no run thunk! Good grief, down on the sweep, slight top-edge straight into the grille! McGrath looks as non-plussed as a fast bowler should when someone attempts to sweep them

McGrath to Loye, OUT GOT HIM! McGrath dropped it short, as he was bound to do, and Loye tried to keep things positive by playing the hook. But it was a stroke played with no conviction, and a steepling top-edge ended in the hands of deep square-leg!
Clark to Bell, 1 run off the mark straight away, but a bit of hesitation there! Tickled to leg but safely home
Clark to Joyce, no run good length, and defended with a hint of inside-edge
Clark to Joyce, 1 run clipped off the pads and another stuttering single. These two won't have batted together very often
Clark to Bell, no run outside off stump and played on the up to cover
Clark to Bell, no run drawn forward and played coolly into the covers. Solid over
McGrath to Joyce, no run probing line, just back of a length and angling across the left-hander. Defended off the back foot
McGrath to Joyce, no run straighter and squared up as Joyce attempts to work to leg
McGrath to Joyce, no run fizzes past the bat with a bit of cut and good carry
McGrath to Joyce, no run slightly wider but still in the channel. Left alone
McGrath to Joyce, no run starts outside leg but nips back to take the thigh pad
McGrath to Joyce, FOUR runs shorter, and that's an excellent swivel-pull to dent McGrath's ego at the end of the over
Clark to Bell, no run outside off stump once again. No great pace or movement
Clark to Bell, no run banged in a bit this time, but outside off again and left alone
Clark to Bell, no run wicket-to-wicket. Turned into the leg-side
Clark to Bell, no run on the money again. Defended into the covers
Clark to Bell, no run that one fizzed through! Lots of oohs and aahs, but no real alarms for Bell
Clark to Bell, 1 run attempted yorker, but easily driven out for a single to mid-on. Bell keeps the strike, which Australia might not mind too much
McGrath to Bell, FOUR runs short and wide and deservedly timed through the covers. Bell didn't try to hit that too hard, just placed it behind point. Well played

McGrath to Bell, FOUR runs short and wide again! Strangely erratic from McGrath, and Bell - perhaps astonished to get two such rank balls in succession hits this harder and in the air in front of point!
McGrath to Bell, no run width but left alone. Sensible batting
McGrath to Bell, no run shoulders arms again
McGrath to Bell, no run a bit of a squelch as this one nips back to hit Bell amidships. He's not fussed though. Balls of steel
McGrath to Bell, 1 run outside off, and nudged down to third man
Clark to Bell, no run good line and length to resume
Clark to Bell, FOUR runs lovely strike. Good stride and perfect placement, straight through extra cover
Clark to Bell, 1 run width, and a measured carve through point
Clark to Joyce, 1 run defended into the covers, and a scampered single
Clark to Bell, no run dropped in a touch short, and this one is defended into the gully
Clark to Bell, no run bit of a fish outside off stump that time! It bent away from the bat at the last minute, and Bell was tempted. Still, he lives on
McGrath to Joyce, no run bit of nip again for McGrath - he's liking this track
McGrath to Joyce, no run again, good carry to the keeper from outside off stump. Joyce plays inside the line, as is his wont
McGrath to Joyce, no run probing stuff, played with an angled bat into the gully
McGrath to Joyce, no run tries to turn this to leg, but slightly squared up
McGrath to Joyce, FOUR runs lovely strike. McGrath is serving up far too many four-balls by his own high standards. Width again, and cracked past point for another boundary
Clark to Bell, no run turned to leg, another loud call stops the single
Clark to Bell, no run line and length, respectfully defended
Clark to Bell, 2 runs a fraction short, and Bell swings into a big ambitious pull over midwicket. Goes high, but well in front of the man in the deep. Decent shot
Clark to Bell, 1 run width, and slapped past point
Clark to Joyce, no run straighter, and defended back down the pitch
Clark to Joyce, no run pushed into the covers to complete another tidy over
McGrath to Bell, no run oooh! Sawn in half by a big nip-backer. Passed through bat and midriff
McGrath to Bell, 1 run fuller, and drawn forward to defend
McGrath to Joyce, 1 wide strays down the leg side. Another extra
McGrath to Joyce, 1 run quick single from a nudge into the gully. The shy was way off target though
McGrath to Bell, 1 run width, and nudged down to third man
McGrath to Joyce, no run tighter line, just back of a length. Joyce plays inside the line again
McGrath to Joyce, no run attacking intent - down the pitch to meet McGrath, and a leading edge deflects through point
Clark to Bell, no run good wheels, Stuey, good wheels. Right in the channel again
Clark to Bell, 1 run another nudge into the gully, and a near-miss on that quick single. Joyce forgot that Clarke is left-handed in the field, and that might have been out if he had hit!
Clark to Joyce, 1 run slightly squared up, but safe
Clark to Bell, 1 run bang! Symonds takes out the leg stump at the non-striker's end, but Bell is home for another single
Clark to Joyce, 1 run defended with an angled bat to point. The batsmen rotate the strike again
Clark to Bell, no run outside off stump, and left alone to finish
Tait to Joyce, no run good swinging full length. Maybe not as sharp as his first spell, but rapid nonetheless. Nothing has dropped below 90mph yet (144kph)
Tait to Joyce, no run outside off, driven without much power
Tait to Joyce, 1 run short and swung into the leg-side. Cleaned up on the square-leg boundary
Tait to Bell, 3 runs fuller length, and nicely timed down the ground by Bell.

Tait to Joyce, FOUR runs that's a lovely strike from a man who's really starting to flourish now! Gave himself heaps of room by retreating to leg, and thwacked that through the covers. Nick Knight would be proud
Tait to Joyce, 1 run banged in, swung away. A useful over for England
Clarke to Joyce, 1 run starts with a gentle leg-stump half-volley. Clipped away
Clarke to Bell, 1 run paddle-sweep to fine leg. Good measured shot
Clarke to Joyce, no run clipped to leg
Clarke to Joyce, no run good flight, calm defence
Clarke to Joyce, no run drifted across Joyce, and that was a bit of a loose waft. And he knows it
Tait to Bell, 2 runs strays onto the pads, clipped away
Tait to Bell, no run driven firmly but fielded in the followthrough by Tait
Tait to Bell, no run snorter! That was short, quick, straight, and vicious. Bell played it very well to be fair, watching closely and swaying out of line
Tait to Bell, 5 wide tried to follow up with the yorker, but that was sprayed down leg. Nice idea, poorly executed
Tait to Bell, 1 run
Tait to Joyce, no run
Tait to Joyce, no run fuller but slightly off-line. Joyce can't get it away though
Clarke to Bell, no run dabbed into the covers, and a scampered single
Clarke to Bell, 1 run
Clarke to Joyce, 2 runs flapped out into the deep. Bit of a top-edge
Clarke to Joyce, 1 run
Clarke to Bell, 1 run
Clarke to Joyce, 1 run
Bracken to Joyce, no run defended into the covers
Bracken to Joyce, no run turned into the leg-side
Bracken to Joyce, 1 run another quick single into the covers
Bracken to Bell, 1 run
Bracken to Joyce, 1 run steps across his stumps and turns this to mid-on for another single. Good rotation of the strike
Bracken to Bell, 2 runs clipped into the deep to complete the over
Clarke to Joyce, no run turned to midwicket
Clarke to Joyce, 1 run firm clip to square leg
Clarke to Bell, 1 run down on one knee, and drilled over square leg. Not quite timed though, and swept up on the boundary's edge
Clarke to Joyce, no run fuller length, and defended
Clarke to Joyce, 1 run couple of quick steps down the pitch to pick the gap
Clarke to Bell, 1 run firmly driven into the covers
Bracken to Bell, 1 leg bye outside leg, takes the thigh pad, but that's another good quick single. Good communication
Bracken to Joyce, no run straighter and angled towards off stump. Defended back down the pitch
Bracken to Joyce, 1 run steered calmly to third man to bring up a very fine fifty for Ed Joyce. His second in consecutive matches. Well batted
Bracken to Bell, 1 run leg-side again, and dabbed to midwicket
Bracken to Joyce, 2 runs that's a lovely strike. Clip-driven, if you like, through midwicket all along the ground. Just picked up inside the rope
Bracken to Joyce, no run takes the pad, and that's the over
Clarke to Bell, 2 runs down on the sweep, and that's a thick inside-edge. Bit streaky, but gets away with it
Clarke to Bell, 3 runs reverse-sweep - or dab, rather, as he did nothing more than deflect the ball. Found the gap through backward square
Clarke to Joyce, no run
Clarke to Joyce, 1 run excellent running between these two. Another dab to third man
Clarke to Bell, no run leg-sided, misses out with a glance
Clarke to Bell, no run good ball to finish, line and length and maybe even some spin
Bracken to Joyce, no run bit loose outside off stump. A dab and a miss
Bracken to Joyce, no run a swing and a miss to follow up - that was rash. Down the track and a big hoon over cow corner, but hit nothing but air
Bracken to Joyce, 1 run drawn forward with a defensive push, finds the gap
Bracken to Bell, no run driven back down the ground, and that's quick work from Bracken! He fielded in his followthrough and Bell might have been out if his shy had hit
Bracken to Bell, 1 run pushed out to point
Bracken to Joyce, 1 run another nudge towards the cordon. Steady stuff
Symonds to Joyce, FOUR runs sweet strike through extra-cover! That was a gentle loosener, but Joyce cracked it almost one-handed on the up!
Symonds to Joyce, no run dropped! In the air to his left, and Symonds grabs with his weaker hand. That was a slower delivery, but he should have got it. And he's cross
Symonds to Joyce, no run deflected behind square
Symonds to Joyce, no run
Symonds to Joyce, 2 runs another miss! That was an inside-edge onto the pads, and it bobbled past Gilchrist! Lucky, lucky
Symonds to Joyce, 1 run the end of an eventful over, now here's Cameron White.
White to Joyce, no run good start, nice flight, nice line
White to Joyce, 2 leg byes strays onto leg this time
White to Joyce, no run Joyce plays for non-existent spin, and uncomfortably so
White to Joyce, no run clipped into the leg-side
White to Joyce, no run good finish, Joyce leaves alone outside off stump
Symonds to Bell, FOUR runs shot! Drifts onto the pads, and that's clipped up and over midwicket for another boundary
Symonds to Bell, 1 run more good scampering brings up the hundred stand. Well played chaps
Symonds to Joyce, 2 runs played through leg again. Some easy pickings at the moment
Symonds to Joyce, 2 runs clipped off the pads. Good batting
Symonds to Joyce, no run better line and length. Defended
Symonds to Joyce, no run down on the sweep again, and good contact as well. Nine off the over
White to Bell, 3 wide loose again. Short, rank and leg-sided. Bell misses with his swing, but so does Gilchrist with his take
White to Bell, 1 wide loose again. Not good bowling
White to Bell, 1 run driven down the ground, and that's Bell's fifty - his first against Australia. Well played
White to Joyce, 1 run
White to Bell, 1 run excellent rotation of the strike
White to Joyce, no run
White to Joyce, no run tighter now, after those loose early deliveries
White to Joyce, no run

McGrath to Bell, OUT and the drinks break brings a breakthrough once again! And it's that old shark McGrath who does the job. It was short, Bell went for a big swing, and Gilchrist steadied himself under a big top-edge
McGrath to Joyce, 1 run short again
McGrath to Flintoff, no run
McGrath to Flintoff, no run outside off, and Flintoff drives off the back foot into the covers
McGrath to Flintoff, no run tighter to off stump, and defended
McGrath to Flintoff, no run in that corridor of uncertainty again, and dabbed to point
Tait to Joyce, no run full toss driven at mid-off who fields on the bounce

Tait to Joyce, OUT banged in, Joyce plays a tired pull which he doesn't get hold of and the ball loops to wide midwicket. A great ovation as he walks off. His innings has given England something to bowl at and also ensured that John Buchanan gets his wish of making sure Australia are in a
Tait to Dalrymple, no run Dalrymple moves to leg, swishes and misses. That was 93mph (150kph) which is pretty remarkable at this stage with an old ball
Tait to Dalrymple, 1 run full toss, absolutely hammered to McGrath at sweeper where he makes a good stop
Tait to Nixon, FOUR runs short, Nixon hooks and gets a top edge over Gilchrist for four
Tait to Nixon, OUT another one banged in, and this time Nixon plays a really nothing semi-pull shot which lobs to extra cover. A short and certainly not sweet stay.
McGrath to Dalrymple, no run short and Dalrymple swings and misses
McGrath to Dalrymple, no run short of a length outside off stump, and another swing and miss from Dalrymple

McGrath to Dalrymple, SIX runs yet again banged in but this time Dalrymple on it quickly and it goes all the way over midwicket ...it only just carries and it's dropped by the spectator leaning over the fence ...Tait's family enclosure?
McGrath to Dalrymple, 2 runs McGrath responds with a yorker which Dalrymple hammers down the ground
McGrath to Dalrymple, FOUR runs full toss and smashed wide of midwicket where it evades the desperate dive of White

McGrath to Dalrymple, 1 run, OUT driven to long-on, the two players get in a real mess over the second and both end up at the bowler's end ... Dalrymple goes but surely Bopara should have sacrificed himself
White to Joyce, no run Joyce down the track and pads it back
White to Joyce, no run again pad, and this time a loud appeal as well. Nothing doing there, though
White to Joyce, 2 runs swept to deep square leg, good tag fielding on the rope from Bracken and Clarke
White to Joyce, 1 run swept again, straight to the man in the deep so only ever one
White to Flintoff, no run steps back and punches to mid-on
White to Flintoff, no run turned straight to Symonds at midwicket
McGrath to Joyce, no run Joyce back and defends
McGrath to Joyce, no run steered into the slips and slap bang into the one man there ...he's at third slip
McGrath to Joyce, 1 run same shot, but this time Joyce finds the gap and ambles a single as third man fields
McGrath to Flintoff, no run Flintoff cramped as he looks to thwack into the off and he can only push the ball to point
McGrath to Flintoff, 1 run this time he steps back and finds more room, punching it wide of cover to the man in the deep
McGrath to Joyce, 1 run short, pulled to deep midwicket
Tait to Bopara, 1 wide short and wide down the leg side
Tait to Bopara, 1 run glanced to long leg
Tait to Plunkett, 2 runs two steps and sliced to third man
Tait to Plunkett, 1 run bobbled into the off side and a scampered single as Tait fields
Tait to Bopara, FOUR runs sweet one-day shot, opens the face of the bat and uses Tait's pace to the full as the ball is angled through second slip
Tait to Bopara, 1 run bumbled into the leg side
Tait to Plunkett, no run Plunkett aims to run the ball through the slips but misses
McGrath to Bopara, no run full, good ball which Bopara can only dig out
McGrath to Bopara, 1 run full toss which Bopara looks to swing to leg, gets a leading edge and the ball hangs in the air before dropping feet in front of White racing in to mid-off
McGrath to Plunkett, no run short and Plunkett looks surprised that it was not called wide. He has a point, but as long as the umpires are consistent it doesn't matter
McGrath to Plunkett, 2 runs driven uppishly to long-off and Bopara runs well to the danger end for a second
McGrath to Plunkett, FOUR runs overpitched and Plunkett smacks it over wide long-on for a one-bounce four
McGrath to Plunkett, 1 run yorker, well dug out towards extra cover and a single to end

Well, at long last we have a game on our hands between Australia and England. Ed Joyce, dropped on 6 by Shaun Tait, made his maiden hundred to help England to 292 for 7 as all the Australian bowlers struggled. The rate needed is 5.86 but the pitch looks good and this should be a very interesting

Welcome back. Here we go, the huddles are over and we are ready to roll. It'll be Liam Plunkett to take the new ball. Mal Loye will not be taking the field after that blow to the jaw during his innings. Paul Collingwood substitutes.
There's an extra catcher at gully
Here comes Brad Hodge - his last chance to impress before the World Cup? Probably. What a situation to come into
Plunkett to Hodge, no run signs of swing for Plunkett, though this one is shorter in length and outside off
Plunkett to Hodge, no run ripper! Late boomeranging movement and that hoops round the edge of the bat. No foot movement there
Plunkett to Hodge, no run more handy swing, but started wider this time. Feisty first over so far
Plunkett to Hodge, 1 wide too much swing that time, and rightly called wide. But this is encouraging for England
Plunkett to Hodge, 1 wide that's a harsh call. And Nixon behind the stumps mutters his indignation
Plunkett to Hodge, 1 run first runs off the bat, pushed into the covers
Plunkett to Hayden, no run good line, shorter in length, Hayden lets it swing by. Excellent first over
Mahmood to Hodge, no run full in length, bit of movement, clipped square
Mahmood to Hodge, 1 wide erratic - started outside off and swung further away
Mahmood to Clarke, 1 wide oops, wide and wider
Mahmood to Clarke, no run straighter this time. Pushed back down the pitch
Mahmood to Clarke, no run good discipline
Mahmood to Clarke, no run
Mahmood to Clarke, no run good line and length - left alone to finish a successful over
Plunkett to Hayden, no run good pace and sharp nip off the track. Hayden is squared up and hit in the midriff
Plunkett to Hayden, no run good length - slightly fuller
Plunkett to Hayden, no run
Plunkett to Hayden, 1 leg bye drifting down leg, and deflects away for a single
Plunkett to Clarke, no run sharp pace, nips away late
Plunkett to Clarke, FOUR runs excellently timed off the legs. Panesar at fine leg can't cut that off and that's Australia's first boundary of the innings
Mahmood to Hayden, 1 run drifts onto the legs, and clipped down to fine leg - where the substitute Chris Read fields! Blimey, we'd forgotten he was still here!
Mahmood to Clarke, no run left alone. Clarke needs to be watchful
Mahmood to Clarke, no run right back and into line
Mahmood to Clarke, no run pushed into the covers
Mahmood to Clarke, 1 run strays in line again
Mahmood to Hayden, FOUR runs and that's gone too fine for Read at fine leg to cut off. Another boundary and Hayden's first
Plunkett to Clarke, 3 runs that's gone fine as well, and Monty Panesar produces a sprawling fumbled stop at fine leg to cut off the boundary. There's no faulting his effort
Plunkett to Hayden, no run back of a length but straighter and swinging back in. Left alone
Plunkett to Hayden, no run good probing stuff. There's some nice trampoline bounce for the seamers outside off stump
Plunkett to Hayden, no run carbon copy of the last two balls. Plunkett's using his height well, and Hayden leaves alone
Plunkett to Hayden, no run a bit wider, but still no shot offered
Plunkett to Hayden, no run less threatening now. Too short and too wide, but Hayden's not tempted
Mahmood to Clarke, no run decent line and length, but Clarke's not troubled
Mahmood to Clarke, 2 runs beats the infield with a firm push through the covers
Mahmood to Clarke, no run shoulders arms once again. Cagey stuff from Australia so far
Mahmood to Clarke, 3 runs too straight, and angling onto the legs, clipped very firmly to deep midwicket, where Panesar fields just inside the rope
Mahmood to Hayden, 2 runs and now leg-sided to the left-hander as well. Too short too, and clipped square
Mahmood to Hayden, no run fuller and wider, Hayden drives but short cover fields well and threatens a shy at the non-striker's end
Plunkett to Clarke, no run short but straight. Defended into the gully
Plunkett to Clarke, 1 run too short again. Clarke pushes into the covers and sets off at once. Bell at cover shies underarm but misses
Plunkett to Hayden, no run outside off stump, and left alone
Plunkett to Hayden, no run a fraction fuller, but still not tempting the stroke. That glorious first delivery seems a bit distant now
Plunkett to Hayden, 1 run short again, and helped down to fine leg
Plunkett to Clarke, no run that's the spot. Fuller, straighter, and swinging late. Clarke is properly beaten
Mahmood to Hayden, no run outside off again. Left alone again
Mahmood to Hayden, no run fuller and straighter, Hayden gets everything behind it and pushes out to midwicket
Mahmood to Hayden, no run floated up to a yorker length, dug out well
Mahmood to Hayden, no run good discipline. Hayden comes forward and pushes this to cover
Mahmood to Hayden, FOUR runs thwack! A couple of steps and whipped through midwicket with a lot of bottom hand. Bounces just inside the rope. Good selective batting
Mahmood to Hayden, no run looking again, but nothing doing. Defended back down the ground
Plunkett to Clarke, no run short, and Clarke turns turtle. Nixon gathers high above his head
Plunkett to Clarke, no run outside off stump, left alone again
Plunkett to Clarke, 1 leg bye flicked round the corner, and another quick single
Plunkett to Hayden, no run fuller, and defended into the covers. That's a better length
Plunkett to Hayden, 1 wide strays down leg
Plunkett to Hayden, 1 run width, and steered to a tumbling gully
Plunkett to Clarke, no run fuller and pushed back down the ground
Flintoff to Hayden, no run
Flintoff to Hayden, no run on the pads but clipped to midwicket with no great power
Flintoff to Hayden, 1 wide down the leg-side. These extras are adding up
Flintoff to Hayden, no run left alone outside off. Better line this time
Flintoff to Hayden, no run defended out to midwicket
Flintoff to Hayden, 1 run driven firmly to mid-off. Ricochets off Mahmood's knee but good old Monty is on hand to clean up
Flintoff to Clarke, no run ooh, a bit lucky there! A leading edge looped up in the air, but Flintoff couldn't get there in time
Plunkett to Hayden, 1 run short and outside off, steered into the gully
Plunkett to Clarke, 1 wide a bit of an appeal there from Nixon, but umpire Harper isn't won over. Another wide!
Plunkett to Clarke, no run good delivery - fuller and bends round the edge of Clarke's bat. Six of those an over would suit England
Plunkett to Clarke, no run leading edge again, but safe
Plunkett to Clarke, no run thick outside edge to gully. Plunkett is struggling a bit with his action, but he's persevering
Plunkett to Clarke, FOUR runs that one went wrong for Plunkett. Dragged down, wide of off stump, and flailed over point
Plunkett to Clarke, no run better line and length. Fuller and straighter, and defended
Flintoff to Hayden, no run outside off and left alone again
Flintoff to Hayden, no run too much width again, but Hayden doesn't chase it
Flintoff to Hayden, no run better line. Much tighter to off stump, and Hayden shoulders arms
Flintoff to Hayden, no run still no shot being offered. Good disciplined line and length
Flintoff to Hayden, no run left alone again. Lots of dot balls
Flintoff to Hayden, 1 run smacked to long-on, stopped inches inside the rope
Plunkett to Hayden, 1 run edged into his body, a yes-no moment and then they scurry through
Plunkett to Symonds, 1 run
Plunkett to Hayden, 1 wide
Plunkett to Hayden, no run
Plunkett to Hayden, no run
Plunkett to Hayden, no run
Flintoff to Symonds, 1 run
Flintoff to Hayden, SIX runs
Flintoff to Hayden, no run
Flintoff to Hayden, 2 runs
Flintoff to Hayden, no run
Flintoff to Hayden, no run
Plunkett to Symonds, no run
Plunkett to Symonds, no run
Plunkett to Symonds, no run
Plunkett to Symonds, no run
Plunkett to Symonds, no run
Plunkett to Symonds, 1 wide
Plunkett to Symonds, no run
Flintoff to Hayden, FOUR runs on the middle and leg stump line, flicked away to the fine leg fence, easy runs
Flintoff to Hayden, no run
Flintoff to Hayden, FOUR runs short and wide outside the off stump, Flintoff is clearly struggling here, Hayden picks it up early and cuts it away to the backward point fence
Flintoff to Hayden, FOUR runs four more! another massive cut and the ball screams away to the point fence
Flintoff to Hayden, 2 runs inside edge onto the pads and they scamper through for a single, Flintoff moves across and tries to kick the ball on to the stumps but misses the traget
Flintoff to Hayden, FOUR runs take that! what and over! again width offered outside the off stump and Hayden smokes it through cover point
Mahmood to Symonds, FOUR runs it's raining fours. massive outside edge and the ball races away to the third man fence
Mahmood to Symonds, no run
Mahmood to Symonds, 2 runs flicked away to the leg side for a brace
Mahmood to Symonds, no run beaten outside the off stump
Mahmood to Symonds, no run defended on the front-foot
Mahmood to Symonds, no run defended back to the bowler
Panesar to Hayden, 1 run
Panesar to Symonds, SIX runs bosh! that's thwacked over midwicket for a vast six
Panesar to Symonds, 1 run tickled into the leg side
Panesar to Hayden, 1 run tossed up, driven to long-on
Panesar to Symonds, 2 runs
Panesar to Symonds, no run
Mahmood to Hayden, 1 leg bye
Mahmood to Symonds, 1 run
Mahmood to Hayden, 1 wide
Mahmood to Hayden, no run
Mahmood to Hayden, no run
Mahmood to Hayden, no run
Mahmood to Hayden, FOUR runs
Flintoff to Symonds, FOUR runs
Flintoff to Symonds, no run
Flintoff to Symonds, no run
Flintoff to Symonds, FOUR runs
Flintoff to Symonds, 1 run crikey - this is too exciting. Right, massive apologies for all the nonsense just gone by. We are back up and running. I hope ...
Flintoff to Hayden, 1 run and that's Matthew Hayden's fifty. Well batted. Slow at first, but increasingly brutal
Mahmood to Hayden, 1 run too much width, and that's carved down to third man
Mahmood to Symonds, FOUR runs thumped over point! Gave himself room and threw the kitchen sink at that. A one-bounce four, inches inside the rope
Mahmood to Symonds, 1 run something's not right about Symonds' bicep. I think he's tweaked it playing that last carve over point
Mahmood to Hayden, 1 wide short and wild down the leg-side. Symonds flexes some more

Mahmood to Hayden, OUT there's the breakthrough! And it's that man on the drive who does the trick. Lots of width from Mahmood, Hayden went for a big booming drive and it's a smart reflex take from Jamie Dalrymple at short cover! Not the best ball, but the best result as far as England ar
Mahmood to Hussey, no run full and swinging onto off stump. Squirted to gully
Mahmood to Hussey, no run Hussey still not off the mark, and that's the end of an important over
Panesar to Symonds, 1 run pushed insouciantly down the ground. The batsmen jog a leisurely single
Panesar to Hussey, 1 run clipped back down the track, wide of a diving Panesar for another single
Panesar to Symonds, no run on a good length, gentle turn but tight line. Pushed back to the bowler
Panesar to Symonds, no run
Panesar to Symonds, 1 run another nudged single, down to long-on
Panesar to Hussey, no run tidy stuff, turned to midwicket to complete a fine over
Bopara to Symonds, no run skiddy swingy stuff from Bopara, and there's a call for a replay as Nixon whips the bails off. Not out, but sharp work nonetheless
Bopara to Symonds, no run nice line and length, and quite possibly sharper than he looks as well. Defended
Bopara to Symonds, 1 run
Bopara to Hussey, 2 leg byes
Bopara to Hussey, no run
Bopara to Hussey, no run lalalalala ... I'll just wibble away to myself for another over while our feed screws up again
Panesar to Symonds, 3 runs
Panesar to Hussey, 2 runs
Panesar to Hussey, no run
Panesar to Hussey, 1 run
Panesar to Symonds, 1 run good trading of singles
Bopara to Hussey, 1 run
Bopara to White, 5 wide bouncer from Bopara, but Nixon was standing up to the stumps ... so he had no chance. Still, White's not wearing a helmet, so he's asking for it really
Bopara to White, 1 run nudged into the covers to get off the mark
Bopara to Hussey, no run tight bowling, a hint of swing
Bopara to Bracken, no run lovely ball! Hits the seam and fizzes past the edge. A pat of appreciation from Bell
Bopara to Bracken, no run great over from Bopara. This boy's got a bit about him with the ball
Panesar to White, 1 run pushed into the covers
Panesar to Bracken, 3 runs looking to drive on the up. Outside edge down to third man
Panesar to White, no run full face of the bat in defence
Panesar to White, no run straight to the fielder in the covers
Panesar to White, no run beaten and well beaten outside off stump
Panesar to White, 1 run tossed up, driven into the covers, a bit of a fumble and they come through for the single
Bopara to White, 1 run inside-edged to square leg
Bopara to Bracken, no run good line and length again. Defended
Bopara to Bracken, no run a big appeal but that was sliding down leg. Good wicket-to-wicket bowling though
Bopara to Bracken, no run sharp and tight, lively stuff
Bopara to Bracken, 1 run pushed onto the back foot, glanced to fine leg
Bopara to White, 1 run too much width this time and firmly cut, but cleaned up on the cover boundary
Panesar to White, no run probing stuff from Panesar, defended
Panesar to White, 1 run pushed into the covers for a scampered single
Panesar to Bracken, 1 leg bye clipped off the pads, one more to the total
Panesar to White, 1 run driven to cover point
Panesar to Bracken, no run drawn forward in a smothered defence. And a slip is now in place
Panesar to Bracken, no run inside-edge onto the pads. Good areas, Monty
Bopara to White, no run fizzes past the off stump, well bowled again
Bopara to White, 2 runs hint of outswing, firmly driven through the covers. Plunkett on the boundary makes a meal of his elaborate fielding. Still, it's vastly improved to his efforts last week
Bopara to White, 1 run onto the back foot and turned square
Bopara to Bracken, FOUR runs shot! Full and outswinging. Bracken plays it on length and larrups it through the covers
Bopara to Bracken, no run good riposte, beaten outside off stump
Bopara to Bracken, 1 run flashed down to third man off a thick edge
Panesar to Bracken, 1 run turned to square leg
Panesar to White, 2 runs driven down the ground. Good air from Panesar though
Panesar to White, no run tossed up, driven back to the bowler
Panesar to White, no run lovely stuff, flight and guile. Driven back down the pitch
Panesar to White, no run
Panesar to White, 1 run tidy over from Panesar, a leg-glance to finish
Flintoff to Clark, 1 run flashed up and over cover
Flintoff to Bracken, 1 run fuller length, and this one is nudged down to third man
Flintoff to Clark, 1 leg bye strays onto the pads
Flintoff to Bracken, no run tighter line, heavy delivery
Flintoff to Bracken, no run back and into line, Flintoff completes a successful over
Panesar to Clark, 1 run good flighted delivery, a measured push down the ground
Panesar to Bracken, no run tidy bowling, pushed into the covers
Panesar to Bracken, 1 run no width to play with at all for Australia, they just have to work the singles
Panesar to Clark, 1 run run down to third man
Panesar to Bracken, no run floated onto that spot outside off again. A hint of tweak
Panesar to Bracken, FOUR runs he got that one wrong, and is annoyed with himself. A fraction short, and flashed to the boundary!
Flintoff to Clark, no run in the channel of off stump. Tight, constrictive stuff
Flintoff to Clark, no run bouncer! And that's the one for the over
Flintoff to Clark, no run lovely follow-up - flashes past the edge from just back of a length
Flintoff to Clark, FOUR runs short again, but that's cut and cut hard to the backward point boundary. Well played
Flintoff to Clark, no run drawn onto the front foot. Smothered defence
Flintoff to Clark, no run good ball to finish, fizzes past the edge again
Panesar to Bracken, no run a little short, but an attempted cut is mistimed and bobbles out to cover
Panesar to Bracken, 1 run straighter, and turned fine
Panesar to Clark, 1 run clipped into the leg-side. Tight bowling again
Panesar to Bracken, FOUR runs that's too short and wide from Panesar, and that's a firm thud through the covers. Australia haven't given up here
Panesar to Bracken, no run back on a better line and length. Deadbatted

Panesar to Bracken, OUT beautiful ball! Tossed right up, much much slower, and Bracken played all round it as the ball crashed into middle and leg. Another one bites the dust, and with Glenn McGrath now at the crease, it's safe to say the game is up. Or is it?
Flintoff to Clark, no run full length, maybe a touch of reverse swing, dug out to the covers
Flintoff to Clark, no run short and sharp. Clark sways out of line to waft an attempted cut
Flintoff to Clark, no run fuller length again, driven without power back to the bowler
Flintoff to Clark, no run short and straight, but doesn't get up so much. Clark sways out of line again and steers to gully
Flintoff to Clark, 1 run nice shot, stepped inside the line to clip a leg-stump delivery out to square leg
Flintoff to McGrath, no run outside off stump and McGrath watches it go by
Panesar to Clark, 1 run drifting onto the pads, and clipped square
Panesar to McGrath, no run quicker ball, 65mph this time, (105ish kph)
Panesar to McGrath, no run watchfully defended
Panesar to McGrath, 1 run off the mark to huge applause from his Sydney faithful!
Panesar to Clark, FOUR runs shot! A firm thud over midwicket, and Panesar has leaked another boundary off the last ball of the over
Plunkett to McGrath, no run appreciation from Nixon as the ball thuds into his gloves
Plunkett to McGrath, no run outside off stump again, McGrath fishes and misses
Plunkett to Tait, no run good line and length
Plunkett to Tait, no run pushed onto the back foot, played out to cover
Plunkett to Tait, no run retreats to leg again, and edged down to the gully
Panesar to Clark, 1 run full length and flashed just wide of Andrew Strauss at short midwicket
Panesar to Tait, FOUR runs mowed down the ground! That was a good old-fashioned tail-end biff!
Panesar to Tait, SIX runs and so was that, with knobs on! VAST six, slapped way, way over cow corner! That was tossed up at less than 100kph (56mph). He might spear the rest in
Panesar to Tait, no run beaten outside off stump, though he was swinging hard
Panesar to Tait, 1 run slapped out to cover point
Panesar to Clark, no run drawn onto the front foot, and defended into the gully.
Plunkett to Tait, no run pushed onto the back foot again. Played out to cover
Plunkett to Tait, no run backing away, and squared up as well, all in the same shot. A good old-fashioned tail-end tangle
Plunkett to Tait, 1 leg bye turned to fine leg to bring up the 200
Plunkett to Clark, no run full on off stump this time, pushed out to cover

Andrew Symonds will not bat, and so England, believe it or not, have achieved the unachievable, and beaten Australia by the hefty margin of 92 runs! That even means a bonus point, to put a teeny bit of pressure on the Kiwis ...

Okay, so Australia had their foot off the pedal and their eyes on bigger contests, but it was still a worthy performance nonetheless. It was set up by Ed Joyce's maiden ODI century, and sealed by some tidy bowling from Liam Plunkett in particular.

That's it from us today. We've been Andrew Miller and Martin Williamson. Thanks for bearing with us through our technical glitches. Join us then from 0300 GMT on Sunday for the showdown between Australia and New Zealand at Melbourne.
England won by 92 runs
Player of the match is Ed Joyce, ENG
